Sentence.sentence: Nations from around the world have gathered in Paris for the United Nations Climate Change Conference, COP 21, with the goal of a universal and potentially legally-binding agreement on reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Monsanto's critics have attacked the company for its "merciless legal battles against small farmers," and they are hoping this will be the case that puts it in its place.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: He said "Monsanto should not be able, just because they've got billions of dollars to spend on legal fees, to try to terrify farmers into obeying their agreements by massive force and threats
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Some law firms now use artificial intelligence software to scan and read mountains of legal documents, work that previously was performed by highly-paid human lawyers.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: This allegation has led to Google becoming mired in (陷入) a legal battle whose scope and complexity makes the Jarndyce and Jarndyce case in Charles Dickens' Bleak House look straightforward.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Google has involved itself in a legal battle as it ignored the copyright of the books it scanned
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Yet the consensus among most economists is that immigration, both legal and illegal, provides a small net boost to the economy.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: They emphasize parents' legal responsibilities.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It is regarded as a legal obligation
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The 1976 copy right act has not prevented these abuses fully, but it has clarified the legal rights of the injured parties and given them an avenue for remedy.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Some states require parents or a home tutor to meet teacher certification standards, and many require parents to complete legal forms to verify that their children are receiving instruction in state approved curriculum.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Workers have the legal rights to refuse certain unsafe work assignments under two federal laws: the Occupational Safety and Health Act and the National Labor Relations Act.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: "As advocates of children's rights, we believe that children should have a voice about what information is shared about them if possible," says Stacey Steinberg, a legal skills professor at the University of Florida Levin College of Law in Gainesville.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: On the one side, you have the United States government's mighty legal and security apparatus fighting for data of the most sympathetic sort: the secrets buried in a dead mass murderer' phone.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: There will probably be months of legal confrontation, and it is not at all clear which side will prevail in court, nor in the battle for public opinion and legislative favor.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: This means minors enjoy material benefits and legal protections that would have been the envy of those living in the past.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: This means they are paid the lowest legal wage and receive no health care or other benefits provided to full-time employee.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

stems_affixes.word_buile: il不+legitimate合法的→adj.不合法的,私生的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 法律的,法定的;合法的,正当的
stems_affixes.word_buile: leg法律+al……的→adj.法律的,法定的;合法的,正当的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 合法的, 合理的, 正统的
stems_affixes.word_buile: leg法律+itm+ate表形容词→adj.合法的, 合理的, 正统的
il不+legible可读的→adj.难读的,难认的
legend[n.传说,传奇;图例]+ary……的→adj.传说的,传奇的
de加强+leg法律+ate人,也可表示动词→加强法律之人→代表

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不法, 私生, 反常, 不合逻辑
stems_affixes.word_buile: illegitimate[adj.不合法的,私生的]+cy表名词→n.不法, 私生, 反常, 不合逻辑

stems_affixes.value_cn: 合法,墨守陈规,法律上的义务
stems_affixes.word_buile: legal[adj.法律的,法定的;合法的,正当的]+ity表名词→n.合法,墨守陈规,法律上的义务

stems_affixes.value_cn: 学院,高等专科学校,大学
stems_affixes.word_buile: col共同+leg讲,读,说+e→共同说,共同读的地方→大学
leg讲,读,说+end→讲出的东西→传奇的故事;引申为地图的图例

stems_affixes.value_cn: 功课,课;一堂课,一节课;[常复]课程;教训
stems_affixes.word_buile: less=leg讲,读,说+on表名词→讲话,教训→课
de加强+leg法律+ate人,也可表示动词→加强法律之人→代表
re反+leg法律+ate表动词→反法律的人被放逐

Sentence.sentence: In 2005, IBM noted in a court filing that it had been issued more than 300 business-method patents despite the fact that it questioned the legal basis for granting them.

Sentence.sentence: The legal issues in the case are obscure: whereas the Supreme Court has ruled that states do have some regulatory authority over nuclear power, legal scholars say that Vermont case will offer a precedent-setting test of how far those powers extend.

Sentence.sentence: However,the Justices said that Arizona police would be allowed to verify the legal status of people who come in contact with law enforcement.

Sentence.sentence: One is the excessive costs of a legal education.

Sentence.come: 出自-2014年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The court’s ruling is legally sound in defining a kind of favoritism that is not criminal.

Sentence.sentence: But with legal battles ahead, the zone's future looks uncertain at best.

Sentence.sentence: Our legal system was designed to set law apart from politics precisely because they are so closely tied.

Sentence.sentence: The success of Sci-Hub, which relies on researchers passing on copies they have themselves legally accessed, shows the legal ecosystem has lost legitimacy among its users and must be transformed so that it works for all participants.

entry.def: Legal is used to describe things that relate to the law.
entry.tran: 法律（上）的；司法的；法制的

example.ex: He vowed to take legal action.
example.tran: 他誓言要采取法律行动。

entry.def: An action or situation that is legal is allowed or required by law.

example.ex: What I did was perfectly legal.
...drivers who have more than the legal limit of alcohol.
example.tran: 血液中酒精含量超过法定限度的司机

means.word_mean: 1. established by or founded upon law or official or accepted rules
4. relating to or characteristic of the profession of law;

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'to do with Mosaic law'): from French, or from Latin legalis, from lex, leg- 'law'. Compare with loyal
